Class SortingMachine<T extends Comparable<T>>

java.lang.Object
SortingMachine<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the items that will be sorted
public class SortingMachine<T extends Comparable<T>> extends Object
Sorting class where the algorithm can be selected

    • selectSortingAlgorithm

      public void selectSortingAlgorithm(SortingMachine.SortingAlgorithmEnum choice)
      implements the sorting functions for sortingCallbacks.SortCallback according to choice input

      #######################################
      Bubble-sort

      While the array is not sorted:
      For each element, if any is misplaced:
      note that the array is not sorted and swap

      Theta(n^2)

      #######################################
      Insertion-sort

      Divide and conquer. Consider that the array consists of a sorted and unsorted array
      Assume i := last sorted index, j := first unsorted index
      Hold element at j, while element at i and element at j are misplaced: copy i to i+1 and decrement i When the above condition is false, replace i+1 with held element

      O(n^2), Omega(n)

      #######################################
      Selection-sort

      Divide and conquer. Consider that they array consists of a sorted and unsorted array
      For each element in the sorted part of the array, check every element in the unsorted part for a necessary swap
      When the entire unsorted part has been looped and swapped,
      we know that the element in the sorted part is correctly positioned

      Theta(n^2)

      Parameters:
      choice - the selected sortingAlgorithm for sort()

    • selectMismatchFunction

      public void selectMismatchFunction(SortingMachine.SortingOrderEnum order)
      Sets the mismatch function for mismatchCallback
      Parameters:
      order - the desired sorting order. ASCENDING or DESCENDING
